profile.about:
I work to ideate, design, develop and test novel solutions and techniques for creating pleasant and streamlined end-user experiences. From mobile technologies, to web, to cross-reality experiences, I've worked in a number of domains to develop new ways for people to interact with information in a more intuitive manner.

My experience as a research scientist and systems engineer has allowed me to experience and touch the product lifecycle at all points, and its my belief that efficient, quick iteration lets products flourish. I'm looking for opportunities that would allow me to work closely with a team and end-users to build technologies that improve and simplify every day life experiences.
profile.name: Nathan Hahn

nodes.company: U.S. Army DEVCOM Army Research Laboratory

nodes.description: A virtual reality command and control application for the Army which supports distributed collaboration using 3D terrain maps.
nodes.name: XR-COP

nodes.description: We ran a study showing how eye-gaze in Augmented Reality (AR) can help reduce cognitive burden by hiding unnecessary information in a congested environment.
nodes.name: Eye-Gaze AR Information Mediation
nodes.who: DEVCOM Army Research Labs & UT Austin

nodes.description: Fuse allows users to manage, and compile their messy browser tabs in to a structured workspace. It's available now as Skeema, a chrome extension.
nodes.name: Fuse

nodes.description: Meta is a tool that allows users to extract and compare entities (in this case products) across websites. From a search, it would collate the most recommended products from a variety of sources into a single view.
nodes.name: Meta

nodes.major: Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.), Human Computer Interaction
Bachelor of Science (BS), Information Systems and Human Computer Interaction
